title: Why Riot needs to improve their shit, and actually get on Banning people.
body:
You know what's a sad thought, being told here several times by Riot volunteer's that the game isn't toxic, and yet being subjected to the same sort of toxicity that got me a 14 day ban a long while ago.

Even worse, is it's RARE to see people in the game having fun instead of just being flat out toxic with other players.

And then we come down to what that really means.

For no apparent reason, My GF has been wanting to get involved in league, and is constantly showing an interest in the game, because it's an interest to me.

And i consistently try and get her to not play it, because the new player experience is terrible, and even for veterans, don't fucking play this game if you can't take constant belittling for no fucking reason.

And you know what?

I bet a lot of us, actually have someone that would be interested in the game, for one reason or another, if it weren't for the toxicity, that we'd recommend, whether it's family members that want to take an interesting in what you have fun with, parent's interested in what their kids are doing, whatever.

And the toxicity that i experience game in, game out, makes me wonder why Riot can ever say that the game is family friendly, because they don't do enough bans for that to be the case.

In the past 3 days, i have come across so many toxic players that i'm forced to report, and you want to know what?

In those 3 days, i haven't seen a single report telling me that someone in my game that i reported got banned.

Whether it's premades abusing people, people who are just vulgar as fuck, boosted accounts, what have you.

So whenever i get told by Riot volunteer's that the community is a good thing, and that the bot is doing it's job, and all the things they are willing to spout in Riot's defense, it really just makes me sad, that they have come to accept that the toxicity in the game is ok.

I mean, there are people that come onto these boards, having openly racist, vulgar, homophobic remarks, and a lot of these players have been playing this game for YEARS before being picked up by the bot.

And let's face it, it's not like these people have gotten worse over their time in the game, they are only just now being spotted.

But hey to finish this up, i want to point out, i can't even give helpful tips to my enemies when playing the game, because they think i'm being sarcastic and toxic, i can't give advice to fellow team members, because they will tell me to fuck off.

I have gotten to the point in this game, where i just mostly stay off my keyboard, and that isn't making it a better experience, it makes it worse.

*FYI, bit of a wall of text.*

Just so we're on the same page, what comments are you referring to when you say that you have been told by volunteers that the game isn't toxic? I can't, for the life of me, recall any.

I agree with the sentiment, though. I honestly believe Riot needs to work on the report and punishment systems, in several ways. There's been a few comments from others on the boards that have got me thinking about this much more than I usually do, and it's lead me to the conclusion that Riot needs to step up their "game" when it comes to toxicity.

I just would like to take a moment to give some context on my perception of toxicity in-game. The fact is, I don't experience it nearly as much, or to the same extent, as most other players seem to, based on the feedback that appears on the boards. I only see toxicity in-game occasionally, and it's pretty much always rather benign, such as someone getting a bit upset that they didn't get the role/position/champ they wanted (usually just a bit of whinging in team chat) or someone starting a game when they know they need to leave for school/work in ~20 minutes. With that in mind, I'm entirely reliant on feedback from other players to understand the true extent of toxicity in-game. The reason I bring this up is because, in retrospect, I realise some of my comments may come off as me implying there isn't much/any toxicity in-game, and that's not my intention.

I'm not going to say the community is a good thing, because I'd probably be lying. Even the players who aren't necessarily toxic in-game can become pretty god dam annoying when they feel their perceptions aren't being met, not to say they're wrong to want a toxicity free game, but they definitely don't present themselves very well when expressing that.

As for the Instant Feedback system, I completely understand your frustration with that. I rarely have reason to report people and I get frustrated with the IFS. Not so much because I don't get notifications (I do, rarely), but because it is a wasted concept. It's still not in the position that Riot said they wanted it in when they announced it, before it was implemented on live. It's been, what, a year now? And Riot haven't been able to get it to notify more than one person each time a player is punished? It's ridiculous, if you ask me. The IFS is a great concept, and it has a lot of potential, but it is completely wasted in it's current state, and I honestly think it does more harm than good at the moment.

On a final note, I do have something to say to your GF, and I do hope you'll show this to her;
"You should trust him when he says the new player experience is terrible. I've tried to get a few friends into LoL, and they've all given up because of how bad the new player experience is. There are a lot of ways in which Riot could *definitely* do far better when addressing toxicity, but they don't. They seem to care more about money than actually creating an enjoyable game. I honestly think it's arguable that LoL is one of the most toxic, if not *the* most toxic, games available. The only reason I continue to play now is because I still enjoy it after all this time. I started at a time when things weren't nearly as bad, and have been drawn back in time and time again. Don't fall into that trap. Trust JasonWazza on this one."
